tn.text: In chapter 8 Moses ordains Aaron and his sons as priests according to the commands of Yahweh that Moses recorded in the book of Exodus.
"the priestly garments" or "the clothes that the priests wore"

tn.ref: Yahweh has commanded to be done
tn.text: This can be translated in active form. AT: "Yahweh commands us to do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This is a symbolic action. It is a ritually cleaning that prepares them to become priests. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])

tn.ref: the tunic ... the sash ... the robe ... the ephod ... the finely-woven waistband
tn.text: woven waistband** - These are special garments that Yahweh commanded the people to make for the priests. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
a long piece of cloth that is tied around the waist or chest
"tied it around him"

tn.ref: He placed the breastpiece on him
tn.text: "Moses placed the breastpiece on Aaron"

tn.ref: the breastpiece ... the turban ... the golden plate, the holy crown
tn.text: These are all special garments that Yahweh commanded the people to make for the priests. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
It is not clear what these are. They were objects that the priest somehow used to determine the will of God. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])
a man's head covering that is a long piece of cloth wrapped around the head

tn.ref: the golden plate, the holy crown
tn.text: These two phrases refer to the same thing. It was a plate of pure gold attached to the turban.
These are all the pots, pans, shovels, and forks used at the altar.
This is a bronze basin that was located between the altar and the tabernacle.
This is a bronze stand on which the washbasin was placed.
"Moses poured"
This is the plural form of "sash." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:lev:08:06|8:7]].

tn.ref: laid their hands on the head
tn.text: This is a symbolic action that identifies Aaron and his sons with the animal they are offering. In this way they are offering themselves to Yahweh through the animal. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:lev:01:03|1:4]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])
This refers to the corners of the altar. They are shaped like the horns of an ox. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:lev:04:06|4:7]].
"set the altar apart for God"

tn.ref: in order to make atonement for it
tn.text: Here "atonement" means to make the altar fit for use in serving God. AT: "in order to make it a suitable place for burning sacrifices for sin"
This is the stomach and intestines. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:lev:01:07|1:9]].
Translate these words as you did in [[:en:bible:notes:lev:03:03|3:4]].
the coat or skin of a herd animal

tn.ref: laid their hands on the head
tn.text: This is a symbolic action that identifies Aaron and his sons with the animal they are offering. In this way they are offering themselves to Yahweh through the animal. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:lev:01:03|1:4]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])
"Moses cut the ram"

Yahweh being pleased with the sincere worshiper who offered the sacrifice is spoken of as if God were pleased with the aroma of the burning sacrifice. See how you translated a similar phrase in [[:en:bible:notes:lev:01:07|1:9]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: an offering made by fire to Yahweh
tn.text: This can be translated in active form. AT: "an offering he burned to Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
The word "consecration" is an abstract noun. AT: "the ram for setting Aaron and his sons apart for service to God" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

tn.ref: laid their hands on the head
tn.text: This is a symbolic action that identifies Aaron and his sons with the animal they are offering. In this way the they are offering themselves to Yahweh through the animal. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:lev:01:03|1:4]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])

tn.ref: Moses took some of its blood
tn.text: It is implied that Moses caught the blood in a bowl as the blood drained out from the animal. The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
the inner parts - This is the stomach and intestines. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:lev:01:07|1:9]].
Translate these words the same way you did in [[:en:bible:notes:lev:03:03|3:4]].
The thigh is the upper part of the leg above the knee. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:lev:07:31|7:32]].

tn.ref: the basket of bread without yeast that was before Yahweh
tn.text: This does not refer to the location of the basket of bread. It means this is the bread that Moses had dedicated to Yahweh.

tn.ref: put it all in the hands of Aaron and in the hands of his sons
tn.text: Here "hands" represents the whole person. AT: "gave it all to Aaron and his sons" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: waved them before Yahweh as a wave offering
tn.text: It is implied that Aaron and his sons presented the offering. The full meaning of this statement can be made clear. AT: "they waved them before Yahweh as a wave offering" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This is a symbolic action that dedicates the offering to Yahweh. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])
Here "them" refers to the fat, thigh, and all of the bread.
Here "hands" represents the whole person. AT: "from Aaron and his sons" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
"They were an offering for setting Aaron and his sons apart for service to Yahweh"

tn.ref: an offering made by fire to Yahweh
tn.text: This can be translated in active form. AT: "a burnt offering to Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

Yahweh being pleased with the sincere worshiper who offered the sacrifice is spoken of as if God were pleased with the aroma of the burning sacrifice. See how you translated a similar phrase in [[:en:bible:notes:lev:01:07|1:9]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
the front part of the animal's body below the neck
an official ceremony that makes someone a priest
This means the basket contains offerings used while consecrating Aaron and his sons. AT: "the basket"

tn.ref: as I commanded, saying, 'Aaron and his sons will eat it.'
tn.text: This has a quotation within a quotation. A direct quotation can be stated as an indirect quotation. AT: "as I commanded you to do" (See:[[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_quotesinquotes]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_quotations]])

tn.ref: until the days of your ordination are fulfilled
tn.text: This can be translated in active form. AT: "until you fulfill the days of your ordination" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This is an official ceremony that makes someone a priest. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:lev:08:28|8:29]].
This can be translated in active form. AT: "us to do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
The abstract noun "atonement" can be stated as a verb. AT: "to atone for your sins" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

tn.ref: this is what I have been commanded
tn.text: This can be translated in active form. AT: "this is what he has commanded me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
